alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 1:12PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino County through 200 PM MST... At 111 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Munds Park, or 12 miles northeast of Sedona, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Munds Park, Dairy Springs Campground, Mormon Lake, Walnut Canyon National Monument, Upper Lake Mary, Double Springs Campground, Upper Lake Mary Boat Ramps, Pinegrove Campground, Lake View Campground and Ashurst Lake Campgrounds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 near mile marker 210. Interstate 17 between mile markers 318 and 326. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim
